intro: Ecdysanthera inflata, commonly known as the inflated bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has hairy stems and leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Ecdysanthera inflata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
